sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations using matrix methods
message_1:
Find the solution to the system of linear equations using matrix methods:

$x+y+z= 6$

$2x-y+3z= 11$

$2x+5y-z= 1$
message_2:
To solve the system of linear equations using matrix methods, we will first represent the system as an augmented matrix:

```
[ 1  1  1 |  6 ]
[ 2 -1  3 | 11 ]
[ 2  5 -1 |  1 ]
```

Next, we will use Gaussian elimination to transform the matrix into its row-echelon form.

Step 1: Subtract 2 times the first row from the second row and the third row to eliminate the x-coefficient in the second and third rows:

```
[ 1  1  1 |  6 ]
[ 0 -3  1 | -1 ]
[ 0  3 -3 | -11 ]
```

Step 2: Multiply the second row by -1/3 to make the y-coefficient in the second row equal to 1:

```
[ 1  1  1 |  6 ]
[ 0  1 -1/3 | 1/3 ]
[ 0  3 -3 | -11 ]
```

Step 3: Subtract 3 times the second row from the third row to eliminate the y-coefficient in the third row:

```
[ 1  1   1  |  6  ]
[ 0  1 -1/3 | 1/3 ]
[ 0  0  -8/3 | -10 ]
```

Step 4: Multiply the third row by -3/8 to make the z-coefficient in the third row equal to 1:

```
[ 1  1   1  |  6  ]
[ 0  1 -1/3 | 1/3 ]
[ 0  0   1  | 15/8 ]
```

Now we have the row-echelon form of the matrix, and we can use back-substitution to find the solution.

Step 5: Substitute the value of z from the third row into the second row and the first row:

```
[ 1  1   0  | 33/8 ]
[ 0  1   0  | 17/8 ]
[ 0  0   1  | 15/8 ]
```

Step 6: Substitute the value of y from the second row into the first row:

```
[ 1  0   0  | 16/8 ]
[ 0  1   0  | 17/8 ]
[ 0  0   1  | 15/8 ]
```

The solution to the system of linear equations is:

x = 16/8 = 2
y = 17/8
z = 15/8
